Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male child? Face only. Mould-made and hollow. Very eroded. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Two similar pieces from Naukratis (NA689, NA564) with a parallel from Tell Atrib dated to the late 3rd to early 2nd century BC (Szymańska 2005, no.195). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.466) (Phase 1)
